requirements.summary: Implement file upload functionality for Word documents with clear format indication and upload feedback
acceptanceCriteria: User can select and upload Word document files from their device
Upload interface clearly indicates accepted file formats (.doc, .docx)
System provides feedback during upload process

file_operations.description: Create file upload component using shadcn/ui Button and Input components. Accept .doc and .docx files. Use the blob-storage component to handle file uploads via ExternalBlob.fromBytes() and track upload progress with withUploadProgress(). Display accepted formats clearly and show upload progress feedback. Verify the blob-storage component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create custom hook to manage file upload state including selected file, upload progress percentage, upload status (idle, uploading, success, error), and error messages. Handle file validation for .doc and .docx extensions.

Create main generator page component that orchestrates the complete workflow. Include FileUpload component for document upload, loading state during backend processing, and TestCaseDisplay component for results. Call backend getTestSuite() method from backend interface with parsed requirements array. Handle backend response containing TestSuite with all test case categories. Use shadcn/ui components for consistent UI. Manage workflow state (upload, processing, results, error).

Create custom hook to manage test generation workflow state and backend interaction. Call backend getTestSuite(requirements: Array<string>) method and handle TestSuite response. Manage loading, error, and success states. Parse uploaded document content into requirements array for backend call.

Wire GeneratorPage into application routing. Wrap with Layout component for consistent design. Set up main route for test case generator. Ensure Layout component is used consistently across the application.

requirements.summary: Display generated test cases in organized, readable format with categorization and export capability
acceptanceCriteria: Test cases are grouped by category with clear visual separation
Each test case displays test ID, title, steps, preconditions, and expected results
Interface allows users to easily navigate between test case categories
Users can export or copy generated test cases

file_operations.description: Create component to display TestSuite data from backend interface. Show categorized test cases (functional, boundary, edgeCases, exploratory, positive, negative, orderedSequence arrays). Use shadcn/ui Tabs component for category navigation. Display each TestCase with id, description, type, preconditions array, steps array, and expectedResults array. Include export/copy functionality using shadcn/ui Button components.

Create individual test case card component using shadcn/ui Card. Display test case id, description, type, preconditions list, numbered steps list, and expected results. Ensure clear visual hierarchy and readability for technical content.

Create custom hook to handle test case export functionality. Support copying test cases to clipboard and downloading as formatted text file. Accept TestSuite or individual TestCase data and format appropriately.

requirements.summary: Apply professional testing-focused visual design with clarity, modern color scheme, and clean typography
acceptanceCriteria: Design uses a cohesive color palette appropriate for a testing/QA tool
Typography is clear and optimized for reading technical content
Layout emphasizes information hierarchy and scanability
Visual style is consistent across all screens and components

file_operations.description: Update global styles with professional testing-focused color scheme. Define CSS custom properties for testing tool theme including primary colors for functional/positive tests (green tones), boundary/edge tests (amber tones), negative/exploratory tests (red/purple tones). Ensure high contrast for readability. Optimize typography for technical content with clear hierarchies for test IDs, descriptions, steps, and results.

Configure Tailwind with custom color palette for testing categories. Define colors for functional (green), boundary (amber), edge (orange), exploratory (purple), positive (emerald), negative (red). Extend typography settings for optimal readability of code-like content and technical documentation. Add spacing utilities for consistent layout hierarchy.

Create main layout component with consistent header, content area, and footer. Apply professional design system with clear visual hierarchy. Use shadcn/ui components for consistent styling. Include application title 'Test Case Generator' in header.
